definition: Ma Chao (176-222), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-

sentences.english: Ma Chao was concealed in the shadows of the opening of the formation.

definition: Zhao Yun (-229), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
Pang De (-219), general of Cao Wei at the start of the Three Kingdoms period, victor over Guan Yu 關羽|关羽/Pound (name)/Ezra Pound (1885-1972), American poet and translator
Lü Bu (-198), general and warlord
Sun Ce (175-200), general and major warlord of the Later Han Dynasty
Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
Dong Zhuo (-192), top general of late Han, usurped power in 189, murdered empress dowager and child emperor, killed in 192 by Lü Bu 呂布|吕布
Yuan Shao (153-202), general during late Han, subsequently warlord
Liu Biao (142-208), warlord
Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
Zhang Fei (168-221), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, famous as fearsome fighter and lover of wine

Cao Cao (155-220), famous statesman and general at the end of Han, noted poet and calligrapher, later warlord, founder and first king of Cao Wei 曹魏, father of Emperor Cao Pi 曹丕/the main villain of novel the Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义
Sun Jian (155-191), famous general at end of Han dynasty, forerunner of the southern kingdom of Wu of the Three Kingdoms
Lü Meng (178-219), general of the southern state of Wu

Guan Yu (-219), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, fearsome fighter famous for virtue and loyalty/posthumously worshipped and identified with the guardian Bodhisattva Sangharama
Western Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms (400-421)
Huang Zhong (-220), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, portrayed as an old fighter
